title: WandbLogger bug

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

body:
## üêõ Bug Report
Hi, I used WandbLogger and faced this problem
![–°–Ω–∏–º–æ–∫ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–∞](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37884009/80644617-9a6d9880-8a72-11ea-9833-a9ff345449aa.png)

Also I noticed that `splitted_epoch_metrics` has structure like:
`{"train": {"loss": 1, "loss_qa":0.5, "loss_clf": 0.5, "metric": 1}, "valid": {"loss": 1,"loss_qa":0.5, "loss_clf": 0.5, "metric": 1}}`

What is propose of `extra_mode` [here](https://github.com/catalyst-team/catalyst/blob/f58ffac876f514f3b52537d62b5c81b562a93fa9/catalyst/contrib/dl/callbacks/wandb.py#L172)? Maybe in this [line](https://github.com/catalyst-team/catalyst/blob/f58ffac876f514f3b52537d62b5c81b562a93fa9/catalyst/contrib/dl/callbacks/wandb.py#L181) we should pass `metrics=splitted_epoch_metrics` instead of `metrics=splitted_epoch_metrics[extra_mode]` to `_log_metrics` method. If I do so error disappears and all works well.


### How To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
I am running my script with `catalyst-dl run` and getting this error on epoch end. With [this](https://gist.github.com/PUSSYMIPT/db95014542442f2e03cd1fddf7610b88) config. Model is a multitask roberta with two heads, so I have three losses (main_loss=loss1+loss2, loss1, loss2) and one metric. 
So in `state.epoch_metrics` I have something like`{"loss":1, "loss_qa":0.5, "loss_clf": 0.5, "metric": 0.7}`, in `splitted_epoch_metrics` variable i get `{"train": {"loss": 1, "loss_qa":0.5, "loss_clf": 0.5, "metric": 1}, "valid": {"loss": 1,"loss_qa":0.5, "loss_clf": 0.5, "metric": 1}}`, this is enough to reproduce key error. Anyway I don't think that error somehow depends on my code and will also reproduces with any experiment which doesn't have a loader which name starts with `base`. Am I missing something?

### Environment

```bash
Catalyst version: 20.04.2
PyTorch version: 1.5.0
TensorFlow version: N/A
TensorBoard version: 2.2.1
OS: Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS (Bionic Beaver)
Python version: 3.7.7
CUDA runtime version: 10.1
```
### Additional context
I can open PR
